articles.headline: Before Dangers at Sea, African Migrants Face Perils of a Lawless Libya
articles.snippet: Despite the costs and risks, migrants continue to traverse a country where warring militias have become the only law.
articles.abstract: Despite the costs and risks, migrants continue to traverse a country where warring militias have become the only law.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZAWIYAH, Libya — The two 8-year-old Eritrean boys had ridden for days across the deserts of Ethiopia, Sudan and Libya packed in the back of a truck with two other children and a dozen adults. Then they spent another month trapped in a crowded farmhouse that the smugglers used as a pen to store their human cargo.

articles.headline: Apple’s Earnings Surge, as iPhone Sales Jump and China Business Rises
articles.snippet: More than one-quarter of the company’s revenue last quarter came from China, which is becoming an increasingly vital part of Apple’s business.
articles.abstract: More than one-quarter of the company’s revenue last quarter came from China, which is becoming an increasingly vital part of Apple’s business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apple’s growth engine has now shifted unmistakably to China.

articles.headline: Twitter’s Dick Costolo Delivers on Change, but the Right Mix Remains Elusive
articles.snippet: Twitter has introduced new features but continues to wrestle with an old problem: how to help new users enjoy the best of the service.
articles.abstract: Twitter has introduced new features but continues to wrestle with an old problem: how to help new users enjoy the best of the service.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Twitter’s chief executive, Dick Costolo, has begun to follow through on his promise to reboot the company after the executive turmoil and product paralysis that dominated 2014.

articles.headline: Uncertainty Over Impact of a Default by Greece
articles.snippet: Regulators, investors and economists are starting to conclude that after five years of endless analysis and speculation, no one really knows how the markets will react to a Greek default.
articles.abstract: Regulators, investors and economists are starting to conclude that after five years of endless analysis and speculation, no one really knows how the markets will react to a Greek default.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it comes to assessing the consequences of a messy Greek default on global markets, two views have vied for supremacy in the minds of investors.

articles.headline: Elon Musk’s Ex-Wife on What It Takes to Be a Mogul
articles.snippet: Justine Musk, who was married to the entrepreneur Elon Musk, offered her insights on the hugely successful in a series of web posts.
articles.abstract: Justine Musk, who was married to the entrepreneur Elon Musk, offered her insights on the hugely successful in a series of web posts.
articles.lead_paragraph: For advice on how to be a mogul, take it from someone who has been married to one.

articles.headline: 2016 Candidates Are United in Call to Alter Justice System
articles.snippet: Democrats and Republicans alike are putting forth ideas to reduce the prison population and rethink a system that has locked up a generation of young men, particularly African Americans.
articles.abstract: Democrats and Republicans alike are putting forth ideas to reduce the prison population and rethink a system that has locked up a generation of young men, particularly African Americans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The last time a Clinton and a Bush ran for president, the country was awash in crime and the two parties were competing to show who could be tougher on murderers, rapists and drug dealers. Sentences were lengthened and new prisons sprouted up across the country.

articles.headline: 2% Inflation Rate Target Is Questioned as Fed Policy Panel Prepares to Meet
articles.snippet: Officials had planned to start raising rates between June and September, but growth has fallen short of the Fed’s expectations, which could delay that action.
articles.abstract: Officials had planned to start raising rates between June and September, but growth has fallen short of the Fed’s expectations, which could delay that action.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The cardinal rule of central banking, in the United States and in most other industrial nations, is that annual inflation should run around 2 percent.

articles.headline: Wang Jianlin, a Billionaire at the Intersection of Business and Power in China
articles.snippet: Relatives of some of China’s most powerful politicians and their business associates own significant stakes in companies of Wang Jianlin, Asia’s richest man.
articles.abstract: Relatives of some of China’s most powerful politicians and their business associates own significant stakes in companies of Wang Jianlin, Asia’s richest man.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — He controls thousands of movie screens around the world, serving more filmgoers than any other cinema chain. He has invested billions of dollars in real estate projects across four continents. He is building skyscrapers that will redraw the skylines of London and Chicago. He is shopping for a Hollywood studio.

articles.headline: Gay Marriage Arguments Divide Supreme Court Justices
articles.snippet: The justice believed to hold the controlling vote, Anthony M. Kennedy, appeared torn about what to do in a groundbreaking civil rights case.
articles.abstract: The justice believed to hold the controlling vote, Anthony M. Kennedy, appeared torn about what to do in a groundbreaking civil rights case.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Tuesday was deeply divided over one of the great civil rights issues of the age, same-sex marriage. But Justice Anthony M. Kennedy, whose vote is probably crucial, gave gay rights advocates reasons for optimism based on the tone and substance of his questions.

articles.headline: Crowds Scatter as Baltimore Curfew Takes Hold
articles.snippet: Thousands of police officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a curfew amid scattered reports of clashes after a day of largely peaceful protests.
articles.abstract: Thousands of police officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a curfew amid scattered reports of clashes after a day of largely peaceful protests.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Armored vehicles lined this battered city’s main thoroughfares and thousands of law enforcement officers and National Guard troops worked to maintain order and enforce a citywide curfew Tuesday night, amid scattered reports of unrest after a day of largely peaceful protests.
